topic_title: support my opinion and construct hypotheses.
can_do_statement: I can support my opinion and construct hypotheses.

lessons.title: Introducing Opinions
lessons.objective: To introduce basic phrases for stating personal opinions.

cards.example_sentence: Creo que es importante reciclar.
cards.grammar_explanation: Used to introduce a personal belief or opinion.

cards.example_sentence: Pienso que el arte moderno es fascinante.
cards.grammar_explanation: Similar to 'creo que', but can also imply a less firm belief.

cards.example_sentence: En mi opinión, la comida mexicana es la mejor.
cards.grammar_explanation: Formal way to introduce a personal opinion.

cards.example_sentence: Me parece que va a llover hoy.
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing an impression or feeling.

cards.example_sentence: A mi parecer, la solución es más simple.
cards.grammar_explanation: Similar to 'en mi opinión', but slightly more personal.

cards.example_sentence: Según yo, la película es aburrida.
cards.grammar_explanation: Emphasizes the personal nature of the opinion.

cards.example_sentence: Para mí, la música es esencial.
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing a personal value or preference.

cards.example_sentence: Es importante respetar otras culturas.
cards.grammar_explanation: Stating the importance of something.

lessons.title: Supporting Opinions: Giving Reasons
lessons.objective: To learn phrases for providing reasons to support opinions.

cards.example_sentence: Creo que es importante reciclar porque ayuda al planeta.
cards.grammar_explanation: The most common way to give a reason.

cards.example_sentence: Ya que tenemos tiempo, podemos ir al museo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Similar to 'porque', but often introduces a more obvious reason.

cards.example_sentence: Dado que no hay evidencia, no puedo creerlo.
cards.grammar_explanation: More formal way to say 'since' or 'because'.

cards.example_sentence: El concierto fue cancelado debido a la lluvia.
cards.grammar_explanation: Explaining a cause or reason for something.

cards.example_sentence: A causa de la crisis, muchas empresas quebraron.
cards.grammar_explanation: Similar to 'debido a', but can imply a more negative cause.

cards.example_sentence: Por esta razón, debemos actuar ahora.
cards.grammar_explanation: Introducing a conclusion based on a previous reason.

cards.example_sentence: No puedo ir, es que estoy enfermo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Informal way to give a reason or excuse.

cards.example_sentence: Puesto que todos están de acuerdo, sigamos adelante.
cards.grammar_explanation: A formal expression equivalent to "since" or "given that"

lessons.title: Forming Hypotheses: Expressing Possibilities
lessons.objective: To learn how to express hypotheses and possibilities using subjunctive.

cards.example_sentence: Es posible que llueva mañana.
cards.grammar_explanation: Requires subjunctive in the subordinate clause.

cards.example_sentence: Puede ser que haya tráfico.
cards.grammar_explanation: Another common way to express possibility, requires subjunctive.

cards.example_sentence: Quizás vaya a la fiesta.
cards.grammar_explanation: Can be used alone or with 'que' + subjunctive.

cards.example_sentence: Tal vez tenga razón.
cards.grammar_explanation: Similar to 'quizás', can be used alone or with 'que' + subjunctive.

cards.example_sentence: Es probable que gane el equipo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Requires subjunctive, expressing a higher degree of possibility.

cards.example_sentence: A lo mejor nos vemos mañana.
cards.grammar_explanation: Informal way to express possibility.

cards.example_sentence: Si tuviera dinero, viajaría por el mundo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Conditional clause using the imperfect subjunctive.

cards.example_sentence: En caso de que llueva, trae un paraguas.
cards.grammar_explanation: Requires subjunctive, expressing a contingency.

cards.example_sentence: Podría ser que se hayan retrasado.
cards.grammar_explanation: Suggests a possibility, requires subjunctive.

lessons.title: Hypotheses: Expected Results
lessons.objective: To learn how to explain the potential results of different hypothesis.

cards.example_sentence: Si estudias, entonces aprobarás el examen.
cards.grammar_explanation: Basic structure for stating a conditional statement.

cards.example_sentence: En ese caso, tendremos que buscar otra solución.
cards.grammar_explanation: Used to introduce a consequence of a previous statement.

cards.example_sentence: Por consiguiente, debemos actuar con precaución.
cards.grammar_explanation: Formal way to introduce a logical consequence.

cards.example_sentence: Por lo tanto, es necesario tomar medidas.
cards.grammar_explanation: Similar to 'por consiguiente', but slightly more common.

cards.example_sentence: Así que debemos prepararnos bien.
cards.grammar_explanation: Informal way to introduce a consequence.

cards.example_sentence: Debemos llegar a tiempo, de lo contrario, perderemos el vuelo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Stating the negative consequence of not doing something.

cards.example_sentence: En consecuencia, la situación ha empeorado.
cards.grammar_explanation: Formal way to introduce a result.

cards.example_sentence: Si no llueve, iremos al parque.
cards.grammar_explanation: Used to introduce the alternative result of an event.

lessons.title: Constructing Complex Arguments
lessons.objective: To integrate various phrases to form comprehensive arguments and support hypotheses.

cards.example_sentence: La idea es buena, no obstante, tiene algunos problemas.
cards.grammar_explanation: Introduces a contrasting point.

cards.example_sentence: Estoy de acuerdo contigo, sin embargo, hay que considerar...
cards.grammar_explanation: Similar to 'no obstante', more commonly used.

cards.example_sentence: A pesar de la lluvia, disfrutamos del día.
cards.grammar_explanation: Acknowledges a contrary factor.

cards.example_sentence: No quiero ir al cine, en cambio, prefiero leer.
cards.grammar_explanation: Introduces an alternative.

cards.example_sentence: Incluso si es difícil, debemos intentarlo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Emphasizes the importance regardless of difficulty.

cards.example_sentence: Además, es importante considerar el costo.
cards.grammar_explanation: Adds more information to support the argument.

cards.example_sentence: Por otro lado, hay que considerar los beneficios.
cards.grammar_explanation: Introduces a contrasting viewpoint.

cards.example_sentence: En resumen, la propuesta es viable.
cards.grammar_explanation: Concludes the argument by summarizing key points.

lessons.title: Applying Hypotheses to Real-World Scenarios
lessons.objective: Apply learned vocabulary and grammar to formulate opinions and hypothesis to real-world scenarios.

cards.example_sentence: Si hubiera sabido, habría traído un paraguas.
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing regret about something in the past.

cards.example_sentence: Deberíamos considerar el impacto ambiental.
cards.grammar_explanation: Suggesting something to take into account.

cards.example_sentence: Es crucial que actuemos ahora para resolver el problema.
cards.grammar_explanation: Emphasizing the importance of something.

cards.example_sentence: Según los expertos, el cambio climático es real.
cards.grammar_explanation: Citing an authority to support a statement.

cards.example_sentence: En teoría, la solución es simple.
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing what should be the case in an ideal situation.

cards.example_sentence: En la práctica, es más complicado.
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing the reality of a situation as opposed to the ideal.

cards.example_sentence: A largo plazo, esta inversión será beneficiosa.
cards.grammar_explanation: Indicating the effects over an extended period.

cards.example_sentence: A corto plazo, tendremos que hacer algunos sacrificios.
cards.grammar_explanation: Indicating the immediate effects.

cards.example_sentence: Considerando todo, creo que debemos aceptar la oferta.
cards.grammar_explanation: Weighing all aspects before making a decision.

cards.example_sentence: En última instancia, la decisión es tuya.
cards.grammar_explanation: Expressing the final outcome or decision.
